parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Chosen by the Parliament of South Australia on 5.9.2012 under section 15 of the Constitution to represent that State in the Senate, vice MJ Fisher (resigned)(term expires 30.6.2017).

parliamentary.positions.title: Parliamentary Positions
parliamentary.positions.para: Temporary Chair of Committees from 12.11.13 to 7.7.14.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: Senate Standing: Privileges from 13.11.13; Scrutiny of Bills from 13.11.13 to 1.7.14; Senators' Interests from 13.11.13; House from 1.7.14; Procedure from 1.7.14; Selection of Bills from 1.7.14.

Senate Legislative and General Purpose Standing: Environment and Communications: References Committee from 11.9.12 and Legislation Committee from 13.11.13 (Chair from 7.7.14); Education and Employment: Legislation and References Committees from 1.7.14 to 3.3.15.
Senate Select: National Broadband Network from 2.12.13; Murray-Darling Basin Plan from 25.6.15.
Joint Statutory: Public Accounts and Audit from 12.9.12 to 1.7.14; Human Rights from 29.10.12 to 5.8.13; Public Works from 13.11.13 to 27.3.14.
Joint Standing: Electoral Matters from 2.12.13 to 1.7.14.
Joint Select: Constitutional Recognition of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples from 2.12.13 to 1.7.14 and from 23.6.15.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Deputy Government Whip in the Senate from 1.7.14.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Senior Policy Adviser to the Minister for Industrial Affairs, Tourism, Recreation, Sport and Racing (SA) 1993-96.
